unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Tests for Two-Way Tables
question_text:
Which inferential procedure(s) could be constructed from a two-way table?
I. Chi-squared test for association. II. Chi-squared test for homogeneity. III. Two-proportion $Z$-test.
solution:
Statement I is correct; if the data comes from one single sample, a chi-squared test for association will be used.

Statement II is correct; if the data comes from multiple samples, a chi-squared test for homogeneity will be used.

Statement III is also correct; if the data is in the form of a $2 \times 2$ table, then a two-proportion $Z$-test could also be used.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'E'.
